chargeHist.descr: Strangulation and Suffocation (with a Previous Conviction)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Strangulation and Suffocation (with a Previous Conviction)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Piantino

records.addlTxt:
BOND TO COVER 22CF340 & 21CF58

BOND TO BE COSIGNED BY BRENDA PIANTINO. DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH. DEFENDANT MUST RESIDE WITH HIS MOTHER. 
DEFENDANT MAY HAVE ELECTRONIC CONTACT WITH VICTIM FOR CHILDCARE PURPOSES.  MAY PICK UP AND DROP OFF CHILDREN BUT NOT ENTER HER RESIDENCE. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. NO ALCOHOL IN THE HOME. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms/limits of the prescription. Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH R.L.O. dob 9-22-1986 or residence, pursuant to 940.47. Defendant is not to be within one mile of victims residence. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Daniel J Piantino in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Daniel J Piantino.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim is present with ASL interpreter K. Ramsay. Victim agrees with bond reduction and asks no contact be lifted. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Pruden. State objects to bond modification. Defendant would reside with mother if released. Court has colloquy with defendant's mother. Bond amended to Surety bond, must post $1000 cash. All same conditions, but defendant must reside with his mother. Bond to be co-signed by Brenda Piantino. Minutes filed.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Daniel J Piantino in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Daniel J Piantino.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Arraignment scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Defendant Daniel J Piantino in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman for defendant. Total cash bond set to cover both cases. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:04 PM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel J Piantino not in court. Attorney Josh Ryan in court for deft. 
SPD is still trying to appoint. 
21CF58- State asks for Warrant. 
22CF340 - Warrant remains. 
Court so orders.
